member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateVocabulary operation. Creates a new custom vocabulary that you can use to change the way Amazon Transcribe handles transcription of an audio file.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language code of the vocabulary entries.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyRequest.Phrases
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Phrases.
An array of strings that contains the vocabulary entries.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyRequest.VocabularyFileUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VocabularyFileUri.
The S3 location of the text file that contains the definition of the custom vocabulary. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form is
https://s3-<aws-region>.amazonaws.com/<bucket-name>/<keyprefix>/<objectkey>
For example:
https://s3-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/examplebucket/vocab.txt
For more information about S3 object names, see Object Keys in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.
For more information about custom vocabularies, see Custom Vocabularies.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyRequest.VocabularyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VocabularyName.
The name of the vocabulary. The name must be unique within an AWS account. The name is case-sensitive.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateVocabulary operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyResponse.FailureReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailureReason.
If the VocabularyState field is FAILED, this field contains information about why the job failed.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyResponse.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language code of the vocabulary entries.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyResponse.LastModifiedTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedTime.
The date and time that the vocabulary was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyResponse.VocabularyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VocabularyName.
The name of the vocabulary.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.CreateVocabularyResponse.VocabularyState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VocabularyState.
The processing state of the vocabulary. When the VocabularyState field contains READY the vocabulary is ready to be used in a StartTranscriptionJob request.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.GetTranscriptionJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetTranscriptionJob operation. Returns information about a transcription job. To see the status of the job, check the TranscriptionJobStatus field. If the status is COMPLETED, the job is finished and you can find the results at the location specified in the TranscriptionFileUri field.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobNameContains.
When specified, the jobs returned in the list are limited to jobs whose name contains the specified string.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.ListTranscriptionJobsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of jobs to return in the response. If there are fewer results in the list, this response contains only the actual results.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.ListTranscriptionJobsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If the result of the previous request to ListTranscriptionJobs was truncated, include the NextToken to fetch the next set of jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.ListTranscriptionJobsRequest.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
When specified, returns only transcription jobs with the specified status. Jobs are ordered by creation date, with the newest jobs returned first. If you don’t specify a status, Amazon Transcribe returns all transcription jobs ordered by creation date.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.ListTranscriptionJobsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListTranscriptionJobs operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.ListTranscriptionJobsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The ListTranscriptionJobs operation returns a page of jobs at a time. The maximum size of the page is set by the MaxResults parameter. If there are more jobs in the list than the page size, Amazon Transcribe returns the NextPage token. Include the token in the next request to the ListTranscriptionJobs operation to return in the next page of jobs.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The S3 location of the input media file. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The general form is:
https://s3-<aws-region>.amazonaws.com/<bucket-name>/<keyprefix>/<objectkey>
For example:
https://s3-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/examplebucket/example.mp4

For more information about S3 object names, see Object Keys in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Settings
member.summary: Provides optional settings for the StartTranscriptionJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Settings.ChannelIdentification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelIdentification.
Instructs Amazon Transcribe to process each audio channel separately and then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single transcription.
Amazon Transcribe also produces a transcription of each item detected on an audio channel, including the start time and end time of the item and alternative transcriptions of the item including the confidence that Amazon Transcribe has in the transcription.
You can't set both ShowSpeakerLabels and ChannelIdentification in the same request. If you set both, your request returns a BadRequestException.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Settings.MaxSpeakerLabels
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxSpeakerLabels.
The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple speakers will be identified as a single speaker. If you specify the MaxSpeakerLabels field, you must set the ShowSpeakerLabels field to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Settings.ShowSpeakerLabels
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ShowSpeakerLabels.
Determines whether the transcription job uses speaker recognition to identify different speakers in the input audio. Speaker recognition labels individual speakers in the audio file. If you set the ShowSpeakerLabels field to true, you must also set the maximum number of speaker labels MaxSpeakerLabels field.
You can't set both ShowSpeakerLabels and ChannelIdentification in the same request. If you set both, your request returns a BadRequestException.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Settings.VocabularyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VocabularyName.
The name of a vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartTranscriptionJob operation. Starts an asynchronous job to transcribe speech to text.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language code for the language used in the input media file.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.Media
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Media.
An object that describes the input media for a transcription job.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.MediaFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaFormat.
The format of the input media file.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.MediaSampleRateHertz
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaSampleRateHertz.
The sample rate, in Hertz, of the audio track in the input media file.
If you do not specify the media sample rate, Amazon Transcribe determines the sample rate. If you specify the sample rate, it must match the sample rate detected by Amazon Transcribe. In most cases, you should leave the MediaSampleRateHertz field blank and let Amazon Transcribe determine the sample rate.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.OutputBucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputBucketName.
The location where the transcription is stored.
If you set the OutputBucketName, Amazon Transcribe puts the transcription in the specified S3 bucket. When you call the GetTranscriptionJob operation, the operation returns this location in the TranscriptFileUri field. The S3 bucket must have permissions that allow Amazon Transcribe to put files in the bucket. For more information, see Permissions Required for IAM User Roles.
Amazon Transcribe uses the default Amazon S3 key for server-side encryption of transcripts that are placed in your S3 bucket. You can't specify your own encryption key.
If you don't set the OutputBucketName, Amazon Transcribe generates a pre-signed URL, a shareable URL that provides secure access to your transcription, and returns it in the TranscriptFileUri field. Use this URL to download the transcription.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutputEncryptionKMSKeyId.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.Settings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Settings.
A Settings object that provides optional settings for a transcription job.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobRequest.TranscriptionJobName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TranscriptionJobName.
The name of the job. Note that you can't use the strings "." or ".." by themselves as the job name. The name must also be unique within an AWS account.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.StartTranscriptionJobResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Transcript
member.summary: Identifies the location of a transcription.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.Transcript.TranscriptFileUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TranscriptFileUri.
The location where the transcription is stored.
Use this URI to access the transcription. If you specified an S3 bucket in the OutputBucketName field when you created the job, this is the URI of that bucket. If you chose to store the transcription in Amazon Transcribe, this is a shareable URL that provides secure access to that location.

member.name: T:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.TranscriptionJob
member.summary: Describes an asynchronous transcription job that was created with the StartTranscriptionJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.TranscriptionJob.CompletionTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionTime.
A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.TranscriptionJob.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
A timestamp that shows when the job was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.TranscriptionJob.FailureReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailureReason.
If the TranscriptionJobStatus field is FAILED, this field contains information about why the job failed.
The FailureReason field can contain one of the following values:
Unsupported media format - The media format specified in the MediaFormat field of the request isn't valid. See the description of the MediaFormat field for a list of valid values.
The media format provided does not match the detected media format - The media format of the audio file doesn't match the format specified in the MediaFormat field in the request. Check the media format of your media file and make sure that the two values match.
Invalid sample rate for audio file - The sample rate specified in the MediaSampleRateHertz of the request isn't valid. The sample rate must be between 8000 and 48000 Hertz.
The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample rate - The sample rate in the audio file doesn't match the sample rate specified in the MediaSampleRateHertz field in the request. Check the sample rate of your media file and make sure that the two values match.
Invalid file size: file size too large - The size of your audio file is larger than Amazon Transcribe can process. For more information, see Limits in the Amazon Transcribe Developer Guide.
Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large - Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is configured to process. To request additional channels, see Amazon Transcribe Limits in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

A timestamp that shows when the job was completed.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language code for the input speech.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.TranscriptionJobSummary.OutputLocationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputLocationType.
Indicates the location of the output of the transcription job.
If the value is CUSTOMER_BUCKET then the location is the S3 bucket specified in the outputBucketName field when the transcription job was started with the StartTranscriptionJob operation.
If the value is SERVICE_BUCKET then the output is stored by Amazon Transcribe and can be retrieved using the URI in the GetTranscriptionJob response's TranscriptFileUri field.

member.name: P:Amazon.TranscribeService.Model.TranscriptionJobSummary.TranscriptionJobName
member.summary:

The name of the transcription job.

member.summary:

The status of the transcription job. When the status is COMPLETED, use the GetTranscriptionJob operation to get the results of the transcription.

member.name: M:Amazon.TranscribeService.AmazonTranscribeServiceClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonTranscribeServiceClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
